Somerset Jeju Shinhwa World
8.4 Excellent
Based on 18 reviews

Boutique Hotel Villa De Aewol
7.5 Very good
Based on 338 reviews

We picked the hotel because of the photos we saw on the internet. There were 4 of us and a room for 4 we thought was better than 2 rooms of 2.

The design of the room, however, was a bit awkward. There was one room within the room for a bed for 2 people. The other bed is in the main room (that is, no living room). That's a minor issue. The major ones are (1) while there are two baths, one of them is right opposite the master bed with a transparent glass wall - so when a person is taking bath there the others shouldn't stick around the master bed area (unless the 4 people swing). That's again a minor issue compared to the biggest unknown reason - one of the toilets sits behind the master bed and separated only by a wall - I mean no door or blinds to cover the entrance. EVEN if we have the decency not to look the smell that comes out when people are doing no. 2 can't but blocked. If only they'd install a door my opinion of the hotel would've improved dramatically!

Show more
Tsui , Hong Kong
Loisir Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8 Very good
Based on 1994 reviews

The hotel situated at very good location, you can found it when exit from Myeongdong Station Exit 6. The Airport Limousine bus stop also just 3 min away from the hotel.

You will enter the Myeongdong Shopping district right away after you stepped out from the hotel. The Nature Republic shop is literally just behind the hotel. My room also got a superb view of N Seoul Tower, just the window need to be cleaned to have unblocked view. There's also a 7-11 shop at 1st floor of the hotel which is quite convenient. Do note that hotel does not provide tooth brush, tooth paste so remember to bring own one. The hotel also charge you if you request early check-in but the hotel do provide you luggage storage lockers and allow you to use free for first 8 hours. Overall, I'll recommend this hotel for its superb location.

Show more
Xin , Malaysia
Nine Tree Premier Hotel Myeong dong 2
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1233 reviews

came across this hotel before it was being reviewed.. so it was like taking a gamble considering it's 6 nights and 4 rooms.

. so why not try? took one of the premier room, triple (as during the time of booking family was suddenly gone and reappeared a few days later after booking), 2 normal rooms.. service - nothing premier or even premier to brag about.. got there in the evening and ask if family room is available for swap with triple.. initially a polite smile n yes together with comments view isn't great.. BUT after the reception spoke to one of the other guy, and discussion in local language without any explanation became a no.. totally understand room changing policy but at least be polite??? I still rem the guy's name at the counter.. room was decent other than a weird smell welcoming us from the toilet everytime we're back.. they now have airport transfer services which not all staffs are aware though it was advertised on their board.. arranged 2 transport but 1 came almost 20 mins late. overall, if price remains as it is, it'll do well I supposed.. but any higher, service has to pick up.. I felt more welcomed by the local restaurants nearby.. location is good as it's a walk away which helps your digestion after the great food in myeongdong..

Show more
Dean , Singapore
Lotte Hotel Seoul
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2041 reviews

Lotte hotel's location is excellent for shopping as it's in the heart of Myeongdong. The airport limosine bus is also conveniently located outside the hotel.

Guests can wait for the bus at the shelter of the hotel instead of standing by the sidewalk in the cold. The staff in the hotel is excellent too- polite friendly and helpful. The staff who assisted us at the check in counter is highly commendable. I was very happy with her service. Will definitely stay here again.

Show more
Aileen , United Kingdom
Dormy Inn Premium Seoul Garosugil
8.9 Excellent
Based on 623 reviews

The hotel is located within 1 minute's walk from Sinsa Station (exit 8). It's a new hotel, and so the rooms were in immaculate conditions.

As Dormy Inn is a Japanese chain, the services provided were according to Japanese standards. The rooms at 16 square meters are small, but the organisation of the furniture makes it very liveable and comfortable. The free ramen supper was great. WE didn't have the breakfast.. because we never woke up early enough,and there are plenty of eateries and cafes around anyway. Fantastic. I would stay at Dormy Inn again at my next visit to Seoul.

Show more
TIANFANG , Singapore
Tmark Grand Hotel Myeongdong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 970 reviews

Pros: Clean and decent location. Cons: TINY rooms, a charge to use pool (?!), no whitener/coffee cream in room, absolutely no storage space within rooms, hotel staff are colder than blocks of ice.

It's likely an OK place to stay if you're on a tight budget and by yourself. For two people +/- young child far too SMALL. There were plenty of spare rooms yet gentleman at the hotel front desk couldn't upgrade us to a larger room like almost every other hotel we've stayed in. Not sure why this hotel was rated so high by prior travellers or why it's considered a 4 star (I don't know what rating will be given after I press submit so I'll state it here: overall 3/10 and it should be listed as a 3 or 3.5 star at most). Would have stayed somewhere else in hindsight.

Show more
Ananta , Canada
Days Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1209 reviews

Just 2 mins can walk to Meyong Dong Metro station, 5 mins to airport bus stop. Various restaurants, cafe, shops nearby the hotel, very convenient.

If you walk to another side, around 5 mins would be arriving Shinsegae Duty Free. Besides, the staff were nice to tell me about some facilities ; and the check in process would not take too long. I'm unpexcted the room size …… many space compared with others hotels also locate at Meyong Dong. The bed is very comfortable, I had a good rest after crazy shopping !!! I will prior stay in this hotel at next time.

Show more
Sylvia , Hong Kong
Nine Tree Hotel Myeong-dong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4572 reviews

There are many plus points for staying in this hotel. 1. 1 min away from airport bus stop. It means that you don't have to worry about traveling to and fro the airport.

2. It is 10 seconds away from a provision shop. It is just opposite the hotel's entrance. For those who don't want to bring baby diapers, you can buy it from the shop. But a bit expensive - Korean Brand. Wet tissues - you can buy them here. 3. To travel with young children is not easy and hence, you might want to travel to places of interest with a tour bus. The bus waiting stop is just 4 mins away. Price for each pax- super affordable. Places like Nami Island, Pettite France and Everland. Just search the Website. 4. Hotel smacked right in the tourist area. Once you step out of the hotel, you can find lots of food. 5. The hotel provides water refilling station at every floor. Other than that, you can wash your laundry at I think level 9 at self service washing machine. 6. The hotel staff speaks good English and the room is clean. 7. Thinking whether you should change won in your country or Seoul. There are lots of money changer near the hotel. FYI. Better to change in Seoul than in Spore. tips... Hope this helps family with young children who wants to travel to Seoul.

Show more
Jack , Singapore
Hotel PJ Myeongdong
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7424 reviews

Comprehensive amenities within the hotel premise - coin operated laundry and dryer machine, cafe, water and ice dispenser at every level pharmacy and family clinic.

I sprained my ankle during the trip and was very glad that there is a clinic just at the first level of the hotel! Room is fairly spacious, just that the lights are the yellow light that will make your room seemed dim. Spacious toilet. It will be helpful if there are signs indicating that guests should refrain from throwing the toilet paper in to the toilet bowl. Coz our toilet bowl got stuck once. The staff are friendly and helpful. The housekeeping ajumas always greet us, and were showing sympathy to my sprained ankle like how a grandmother would do to u. The consumables are replenished on a daily basis. Location wise ok. There is free shuttle bus provided by the hotel to places like myeongdong, dongdaemun. Overall.. I have a good rest in the hotel.

Show more
Ling , Singapore
Royal Hotel Seoul
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1509 reviews

Good location , comfy room. Would be perfect 10 if the front desk staff are more helpful. Could be due to their limitation in language, it seems that A lot of Japanese are staying in the hotel and the front desk staff can speak better Japanese than English.

I have not tried other hotels in Myeongdong area, thus I do not know if it's typical behavior of the hotel staff. We extended our checkout time to 4pm the night before we checkout. We headed out early morning and when we get into the lift we could not get access. Went to the front desk to check and they responded quite coldly by collecting payment from me for the extension and then proceed to re- program our cards. We then went up to our room. Upon reaching our room door we realized we could not open the door which means the hotel staff has not programmed our access cards properly. Went down again and there was NO apology given. I was told (coldly)because we extend therefore it happened. It's a paid extension!

Show more
Lim , Singapore
Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3413 reviews

The location is good for tourists who love shopping in the Myeongdong area, as well as want to explore different places in Seoul.

There are many shops and restaurants next to the hotel and subway line 2 is within 3 minutes' walk. We stayed in a standard twin room, which was big enough to accommodate two suitcases and other carry-on luggage. The bathroom was clean and bigger than we expected. On our departure we took the shuttle bus to the Seoul station, and one of the hotel staffers helped us load the suitcases onto the bus. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Show more
Louise , Canada
Hidden Cliff Hotel & Nature
8.6 Excellent
Based on 453 reviews

Lotte Hotel Busan
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1032 reviews

This was my 6th stay in this hotel. Well, honestly, I was slightly disappointed with the attitude of the staff this time around.

They were unfriendly, quite lazy and had language issues (which is very unlike Lotte Bosan Hotel what I knew). During my stay, it was heavily snowing and was a windy weather, not usual in Busan. When I asked for an umbrella at the concierge, they often could not help. The restaurants are great, but always crowded lobby and common areas (but good thing is that Korean people are warm and nice). Front office staffs were lazy and lack attentions. Over-all, it was just OK stay and there was no wow effect this time. I like this hotel and I will be going back to Lotte Busan Hotel again. Hope they improvise.

Show more
Pranjal , India
Ramada Gangwon Sokcho
8.2 Excellent
Based on 623 reviews

Disappointed with the restaurant/coffee shop. Arrived late for breakfast and the staff is hovering me and my family like vultures pressuring us to hurry.

Returned mid afternoon for some coffee but they only offer take out service. I was hoping to enjoy a cup of coffee in the air conditioning with a view

Show more
George , United States
The Shilla Seoul
8.9 Excellent
Based on 719 reviews

We got told that Shilla is the best in Seoul. my gf and i stayed here two night. It's decent enough but not as nice as what I heard Shilla are.

Bright, modern, new rennovated architecture but it's really not outstanding... The mini-bar in room has a small selection. I didn't eat anything but it all looked like expensive, cheap food. Didn't go to the lounge either but again, expensive for just a drink. The pool, I went there, it was PACKED with local family. If you want a decent chilling afternoon, do not go there. The baby went from the pool to the spa...made 2 local business call in room and got charged A LOT. Shilla must have forgotten we are still in the 80s. The hotel was clean, and was a decent, comfortable place to stay on but it's way overpriced for the services/quality it delivers.

Show more
Wesley , Hong Kong
Shilla Stay Haeundae
8.2 Excellent
Based on 204 reviews

Crown Park Hotel Myeongdong Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 735 reviews

Good location, near to many eateries and 2 convenient stores. Lobby located at level 17 proved a bit of hassle as time is wasted traveling up and down, especially when the hotel has so many levels and 3 small lifts (can only fit 3 pax with luggage) only.

Room is also considerably small compared to another areas in Korea. Cleanliness is good though. Air con will auto switch off once it reaches the set temperature which is quite a nuisance as we have to wake up to reset in order to turn it on again. For business hotel, it shouldn't be auto switch off to save electricity (similar to budget hotel).

Show more
Peggy , Singapore
The Shilla Jeju
8.9 Excellent
Based on 669 reviews

1) We stayed on the day of my sister's birthday. I called prior overseas- was transferred 3 times to what I thought would have been a relatively fluent English speaker.

Took me 30 minutes just to sort out ordering balloons and cake. 2) Had my Korean friend double check the order. We arrive an hour prior to anticipated arrival. But right on time for check in. My Korean friends checked the balloon order- staff said it was fine. Guess what--- there were no balloons in the room. Mind you, the balloons cost about $100+ dollars. 3) The staff "used" our friends to translate everything for us. You;d think this hotel would have fluent English speakers. 4) Automated toilet kept running in thr room. Hair dryer shorted out during stay. Some of the furnishings looked abit old. There was rust on some parts of the abthroom. Some wood chpped in the main lobby area that was fairly obvious. Epected so much more from a 5 star- super exnpsive hotel. defnitely noy recommends for english speaking traverlers.

Show more
Jonie , United States
Amanti Hotel Seoul
8.5 Excellent
Based on 574 reviews

New hotel. Friendly and professional staff. Nice view from rooms and roof top. Rooms are spacious and the bath tub is nice.

A short walk to the fun area of Hongdae with cafes and markets on way. Negatives: The toilet is not smart. Stayed at 4 hotels in Seoul and each hotel room had a toilet that flushed itself and kept the seat warm. Was a minor let down. Also, is non smoking in all rooms and rooftop. Major negative. Especially for the outdoor areas. I cannot comment on pool area as didn't visit due to the additional charge to use the pool (and too busy out shopping and exploring) but would be crazy if cannot smoke at pool either. Overall was one of my best stays in Seoul and would certainly stay again. The front desk was very welcoming and accommodating.

Show more
Luke , United States
Ramada Encore Haeundae
8.3 Excellent
Based on 179 reviews

Hotel RegentMarine The Blue
8.6 Excellent
Based on 711 reviews

The hotel was overall OK, location just across all the nice restaurants, shopping streets, markets. Gym was OK but pool was dirty because there was some construction going on at the surroundings but we did not use it anyway.

Staff was very unhelpful, I went down to the reception and asked them to help me book the tour as the tour staff did not really speak English well. They kinda refused to help and asked us to call ourselves from our room and tell us it will be chargeable. There was no Concierge and when we asked the Reception about surrounding area and they were not being informative at all. Other than that, everything's was fine.

Show more
Airin , Indonesia
Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeongdong
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1114 reviews

We stayed in Hotel Solaria Myeongdong last December 17-21, 2016. We reported both to housekeeping and front desk that my toddler's Mickey Mouse stuffed toy was missing in our room.

But they said they could not find it. Since we arrived in the hotel, we always just leave it in the hotel room. We even have a picture/video that the stuffed toy was still in our room last December 19 morning. But, when we came back to the hotel after going out, it wasn't there anymore. We searched the room and called housekeeping about it. It was a very special toy to my son that's why we were really concerned. It had a sentimental value. The staff of the hotel, both housekeeping and front desk, were not as concerned as we thought they should be. This completely ruined our stay even if the hotel was nice.

Show more
Lourdes , Philippines
Hilton Busan
7.7 Very good
Based on 51 reviews

L7 Myeongdong
8.7 Excellent
Based on 700 reviews

staff are very nice, polite and helpful. especially the one at the ground floor, he greets us every time when we step in the main entrance, and woudl help us open the door promptly.

also the check in counter is not located at ground floor but in this way, we do not have to pass through the check in counter when we go up our hotel room. that makes the check in counter more spacious and comfortable. cant enjoy the foot spa this time as too tight schedule. and one day the housekeeping miss out our room...thats a bit disappointing...but location is gd. and the stool is the japanese one with cleaning functions, appreciate it a lot!

Show more
LAM , Hong Kong
Oakwood Premier Coex Center
8.7 Excellent
Based on 571 reviews

airport shuttle is across a small street --2min walk. if you fly korean airline or a few others, you can even check-in your baggage there.

hotel check-in is on the 5th floor. we had 3 adults and got a free upgrade. the room is like a small apt---1 bdr, 1.5 ba, living room w/sofa, and kitchen (fully equipped). washer/dryer in one but takes forever to wash and dry. the master bathroom has a wet spa as well. there are local restaurants and small shops up and down the street. coex mall is located next door/underground with plenty of stores/food as well. staff were professional and friendly. i happened to be there during my birthday and received a birthday card from them--nice touch when you're away from home. two complimentary bottled waters, no free internet, no complimentary breakfast (they do give you 2 discount coupons for the restaurant in-house). there is a free internet booth down the street near the bus stop. will love to stay again if budget allows.

Show more
JAMES , Canada
Arban Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 882 reviews

We took this hotel because because of near from eye clinic (myhusband took lasik treatment there). We stayed at junior suite, With jacuzzi (it's Good), but the water kettle ia dirty (i think They Not clean It or Change It into the clean one) so we Ask to Change It.

. When breakfast, i think it's Not suitable With the hotel price,, Not have a Lot of choice of menu..

Show more
HEIKE , Indonesia
G2 Hotel Myeongdong
8.9 Excellent
Based on 189 reviews

Without Doubt one of the Favorite Hotel we stayed during our trip in Seoul. Upon arrival 4 of us ( GIRLS Squad ) were warmly welcomed by the friendly staff & he offer to help us to takecare our luggages.

We had a marvelous stay in Quadroom at G2 HotelMyeongdong. Well-appointed comfortable & spacious room with an area of 48 sq. ft. The Quadroom comes with a carefully crafted blend of aesthetics , modern and complete range of top-end amenities including; Welcome innisfree product amenities, Wireless Internet Access etc The Hotel is strategically located in the heart of the City & very closed with Myeongdong shopping area only 5 minutes walking distance, Very Modern New interiors, very comfortable , clean & spacious room with 2 super kings size bed, very good service and some excellent breakfast too. The food was absolutely wonderful, from preparation to presentation, very pleasing. We'll definitely be back! 👯👯😘😘😘😘

Show more
YULIANA , Indonesia
Tmark Hotel Myeongdong
8.3 Excellent
Based on 720 reviews

Excellent choice! The hotel room price was reasonable. Although the hotel is in a small alley, its only a 2 min walk from chungmuro metro station (very convenient because you can change to line 3 and 4 at this station).

The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel staff speaks good english and they are very attentive and helpful. On our last day, we had too many luggages to carry to the nearby airport bus stop, the director of rooms himself and a male staff (sorry couldnt catch your name) took the initiative to walk up to us and offered to help us carry them over to the bus stop. We were very grateful for their help. We would choose to stay at this hotel the next time we visit. Will recommend to my friends :)

Show more
Joscelyn , Singapore
Hotel Leo
8.7 Excellent
Based on 609 reviews

We are from Singapore. I was at Jeju from 10 to 12 Apr 16 with my young adult daughter. Everything about this hotel was great.

1. Reception Courteous and always greeted with smiles.One of the guys even went the extra mile to carry my luggage. Thumbs up! 2. Room Very clean & adequate with air conditioner in the room. From what I know most hotels did not provide air cond during spring time. 3. Breakfast Great with varieties. 4. Airport Transfer Uncle driver was very helpful. Arrangement by hotel staff was punctual. Jessie

Show more
Jessie , Singapore
Kensington Jeju Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 821 reviews

We spent the first night of our honeymoon here, and it was the perfect place to unwind from the stresses of our wedding.

The room was stocked with free drinks and snacks, the view from the balcony was very beautiful, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Service was, of course, of five star quality. Our favorite aspect was the free sauna, which was open from 7 AM to midnight. We spent many hours there, after which we went swimming in one of the many heated pools. Did I mention there's a rooftop pool with a bar? For breakfast, we ate at the LaOlle buffet, and the food was fantastic and never-ending. With all the freebies that came with our booking, we were very pleased with the money we spent at the Kensington. Would definitely stay there again.

Show more
Theresa , United States
Lotte Resort Sokcho
8.6 Excellent
Based on 55 reviews

Hotel Teddy Valley
8 Very good
Based on 304 reviews

For breakfast, the other place we stayed had eggs, apart from cereal and toasts, and really good tea - not to mention the more spacious kitchen and lounge area. We did not feel quite safe at night in the street of the guesthouse - after 10pm there would be quite a number of men wandering around seemingly for no purpose. While I did not see or experience any incidents involving these men, I did not feel quite comfortable going back late to the guesthouse with my family. The guesthouse is about 5 min's walk from Myeongdong shopping streets so would be good for shopaholics; about 15 mins from Seoul station. It is also close to Hyoheon subway station and Namdaemun market is just across the road.

Very basic amenities, only shampoo and body wash are provided. Breakfast was decent - they had toast with butter and jam, orange juices, 2 types of cereal with milk, coffee and tea. There were 4 of us and a room for 4 we thought was better than 2 rooms of 2. The design of the room, however, was a bit awkward. There was one room within the room for a bed for 2 people. The other bed is in the main room (that is, no living room). That's a minor issue. The major ones are (1) while there are two baths, one of them is right opposite the master bed with a transparent glass wall - so when a person is taking bath there the others shouldn't stick around the master bed area (unless the 4 people swing). That's again a minor issue compared to the biggest unknown reason - one of the toilets sits behind the master bed and separated only by a wall - I mean no door or blinds to cover the entrance. EVEN if we have the decency not to look the smell that comes out when people are doing no. 2 can't but blocked. If only they'd install a door my opinion of the hotel would've improved dramatically! Show more Tsui , Hong Kong Loisir Hotel Seoul Myeongdong 8 Very good Based on 1994 reviews The hotel situated at very good location, you can found it when exit from Myeongdong Station Exit 6. The Airport Limousine bus stop also just 3 min away from the hotel. You will enter the Myeongdong Shopping district right away after you stepped out from the hotel. The Nature Republic shop is literally just behind the hotel. My room also got a superb view of N Seoul Tower, just the window need to be cleaned to have unblocked view. There's also a 7-11 shop at 1st floor of the hotel which is quite convenient. Do note that hotel does not provide tooth brush, tooth paste so remember to bring own one. The hotel also charge you if you request early check-in but the hotel do provide you luggage storage lockers and allow you to use free for first 8 hours. Overall, I'll recommend this hotel for its superb location. Show more Xin , Malaysia Nine Tree Premier Hotel Myeong dong 2 8.6 Excellent Based on 1233 reviews came across this hotel before it was being reviewed.. so it was like taking a gamble considering it's 6 nights and 4 rooms. . so why not try? took one of the premier room, triple (as during the time of booking family was suddenly gone and reappeared a few days later after booking), 2 normal rooms.. service - nothing premier or even premier to brag about.. got there in the evening and ask if family room is available for swap with triple.. initially a polite smile n yes together with comments view isn't great.. BUT after the reception spoke to one of the other guy, and discussion in local language without any explanation became a no.. totally understand room changing policy but at least be polite??? I still rem the guy's name at the counter.. room was decent other than a weird smell welcoming us from the toilet everytime we're back.. they now have airport transfer services which not all staffs are aware though it was advertised on their board.. arranged 2 transport but 1 came almost 20 mins late. overall, if price remains as it is, it'll do well I supposed.. but any higher, service has to pick up.. I felt more welcomed by the local restaurants nearby.. location is good as it's a walk away which helps your digestion after the great food in myeongdong.. We were checked in the hotel on the 2nd day after 1pm and the room is not prepared well. They hv difference procedure on extra stay booking which make us very confused. Show more Jia , Malaysia Ewha Guest House Hongdae 8.7 Excellent Based on 256 reviews Bus stops & Hingdae subway station are next to the building that hostel is located. No heat from the ground if the room. The heater is very small that is not enough to warm the room. Suggest to use a larger heater to warm the room. TV screen shows all pictures in yellow color. It cannot turn to the collect color tone. So did not watch TV during in Seoul. Show more KEI , Hong Kong DW Design Residence 8.8 Excellent Based on 829 reviews I would be happy to stay at this hotel on any future trip to Seoul were I traveling solo. The studio room is just big enough, with good Wi-Fi and A/C, and it has a sink and fridge for self-catering. The only downside is that there are no safes in the rooms, or even at the front desk: these are cheap enough now that the owner should consider the investment. Otherwise, the breakfast buffet was simple but satisfying, the location is central to the Hongdae nightlife, and the price can't be beat. NOTE: when exiting the subway, you want to turn left at the top of the stairs, putting the building with the entrance to the Starbucks on your left and receding behind you as you walk to the next corner. Then cross, turn left, and make a right at the next corner (there's a fried chicken restaurant to mark the corner). Show more Bradley , United States K-GUESTHOUSE Premium Nampo 1 8.7 Excellent Based on 281 reviews The room size is small but full equipped with what I needed, bfast was a hassle, waiting for turn to use the pan to fry the egg. The hotel staff should standby there to carry out the task as to eliminate the waiting and queue time. Other than that , everything seems fine to me. I made a mistake going to the one near busan branch, took a taxi but he doesn't know where it is! Can the hotel provide those traditional korean words that their local can understand. Show more Nick , Singapore Artmonstay Guesthouse 8 Very good Based on 70 reviews We arrived at around 12 AM and they were very kind to contact me via mobile and email and gave me instructions for self check in. The owner met us in the building and helped us settled in. I appreciate that they are accommodating, responsive to our needs and very knowledgeable on places to go to and have also checked the restaurants business hours before we go. The serve light breakfast and other food in the cafe. They also have craft beers and ciders. Unlimited coffee! The best part of stay in Artmonstay is the rooftop where Legend of the Blue see was taken. Very good 360-degree city view. And you can have bbq there as well. The proximity is fine as it is near myeongdong station, convenience stores and restos. Will definitely go back! Show more JM , Philippines YaKorea Hostel Hongdae 8 Very good Based on 75 reviews I come with my family, consist of 6 people. This is our first time to Korea, and we dont use any travel agent. So, public transport is essential to us. This hostel is nearby to Hongik Univ train station (5-7 min walk) with lots of convenience stores and coffee shops around. 10 min walks, you will found several malls. The staffs are friendly and always ready to help. If they are not around, you can call them with in-house phone. However, they don't make up your bed and clean your room unless you tell them to do so. They don't do it with scheduled time. Ultimately, good stay here. I'm satisfied, not the best but HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for 4-6 people. Show more Haziq , Malaysia Kimchee Gangnam Guesthouse 8.2 Excellent Based on 370 reviews Staff was friendly and the hotel was recently renovated so all amenities are new. There's a lift in the establishment meaning you don't have to lug the bags up a few floors. Single rooms were small but most are at the same price. Complimentary wifi and breakfast was provided. Only bad point was it was hard to find at first because its located in a smaller lane. Clear signage or directions recommended. Show more Alvin , Singapore Vestin Hostel Myeongdong 6.7 Good Based on 88 reviews Stayed with Vestin Hostel for 6 nights this holiday season. We took the bus going to Myeongdong station from the airport and it wasn't that hard to locate. Very convenient since it's near the station, approximately 5 minutes walk. Near the shopping Myeongdong shopping streets as well! Wifi works fast and there is also television for you to watch. We checked in pretty late at night, so we were pleased as the host was kind enough to welcome us and help us with our luggages. Also, they let us leave our bags and luggages after we checked out since we have late flight going back to our country. Breakfast isn't that much; coffee and bread but it's what you expect from a small hostel. The host also helped us book a city tour! Downside is, the room was too small for three and I recommend they regularly clean the bathroom and change our sheets. All in all, it was a great stay! Show more Marilou , Philippines 24 Guesthouse Myeongdong Avenue 8.3 Excellent Based on 680 reviews We stayed at another place in Seoul from 1 to 3 August and then moved to this guesthouse after our trip to Busan. The other place had a 9.0 ratings and to be honest, by this standard, I'd only rate 24 Guesthouse Myeongdong Avenue at 7.0 at most. The rooms were very small, and the bathroom is even smaller - there is hardly enough room to just turn yourself around comfortably in the bathroom. The lift had a really unpleasant smell during our stay (3 nights). We were not given any advice on the guesthouse's facilities, and therefore only found the laundry room on our last day in Seoul. For breakfast, the other place we stayed had eggs, apart from cereal and toasts, and really good tea - not to mention the more spacious kitchen and lounge area. We did not feel quite safe at night in the street of the guesthouse - after 10pm there would be quite a number of men wandering around seemingly for no purpose. While I did not see or experience any incidents involving these men, I did not feel quite comfortable going back late to the guesthouse with my family. The guesthouse is about 5 min's walk from Myeongdong shopping streets so would be good for shopaholics; about 15 mins from Seoul station. It is also close to Hyoheon subway station and Namdaemun market is just across the road. Show more Van , Vietnam 24 Guesthouse Namsan Garden 8.7 Excellent Based on 389 reviews We were a travelling trio and 24 Guesthouse was decent for us. The room managed to fit 3 big luggage so it was just right. Room was bright and clean, bed linen and towels were clean too. Our attached bathroom was very small and the frosted glass will show silhouettes. Hot water and air-conditioning was consistent. Very basic amenities, only shampoo and body wash are provided. Breakfast was decent - they had toast with butter and jam, orange juices, 2 types of cereal with milk, coffee and tea. Location was great, it was a 5 minute walk from Myeong-dong station. However, take note that there is a steep slope up to the guesthouse, you may face some difficulties with large luggage. Overall, a pleasant stay for the budget traveler. Show more KAI , Malaysia SH Seoul Hostel 8.3 Excellent Based on 227 reviews Guesthouse is bigger than we thought and the location is great. Once you are out of the Green line, take Exit 2 using the escalator. Walk towards the direction of Samsung and look out for Dorocy Shop at the street level and enter into the building to take the left lift up to Level 10 (P.S: Left lift is even levels whilst right lift is odd levels). There you reach the doorstep of the friendly staff from SH Seoulhouse. This guesthouse is very near to the Green Line Subway but quite a fair bit of walking distance to AREX. But who will take AREX everyday right? Therefore, this guesthouse is worth the stay and not to mention, Hongdae shopping/clubbing areas are just across the streets! Show more NG , Malaysia 202 House SeoulStation 8.6 Excellent Based on 76 reviews Philstay Myeongdong 8.8 Excellent Based on 98 reviews Pro: hotel is located at the heart of myeong-dong. And even ita in the center, its not noisy because its located at the 17th floor of the building. Friendly staff! Tasty breakfast. You can even wash your clothes using their washing machine and spin dry! Condusive for sleep after a long day of exploring korea. Con: small bath towel BUT you can change it every after use, you just need to return the used one so that they can provide you a new one. 10 out of 10. -Michael from PH Show more Michael , Philippines Philstay Dongdaemoon Guesthouse 8.1 Excellent Based on 373 reviews We kinda got lost while locating Philstay but we received helped from 2 tourist from Hong Kong and a Korean guy. The staff (forgot his name) even picked us to reach the hostel. Thank you so much! Breakfast was awesome. They have noodles, bread, egg, ham, peanut butter, jelly, mayonnaise, cheese and frosted cereals. For the beverage you can choose from Milk, Orange Juice and Coffee. Facilities were good. Wifi was fast. Staffs were excellent. Loved everything about Philstay. It was near so many restaurants and malls. It was also near the Dongdaemun Design Plaza. If you enjoy shopping and eating at night this place is perfect for you Thanks Philstay. :) Show more Angela , Philippines 24 Guesthouse Sinchon Avenue 7.8 Very good Based on 291 reviews It's located in a convenient location, with nearby subway station as well as shopping and dining places. The room is small but sufficient for a solo traveler with one big luggage. The room will smell like food even when you leave the window open as it is situated above a restaurant. There is no curtain available for the window, so you need to hang a towel over it to block the sunlight. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Overall good value for the money. Show more Ching , Malaysia Kimchee Sinchon Guesthouse 7.7 Very good Based on 867 reviews The Guesthouse itself offered me a very good experience during my travel within Seoul. It was very fun, relaxed, youthful. The staff were very nice and accommodating. I have to mention one of the Staff, Minook - he really went an extra mile to help me. Great service! Thumbs up to you and your team. Highly recommended for backpackers. I did not feel alone, even I am a solo traveler. The staff were friendly and the place is very relaxed, I felt comfortable right away, especially the common are where one can mingle with other Guests and eat and just seat in one of the comfortable couches. There's a smoking area as well. The hot shower is very nice! The toilets were always clean. The wifi service is very good. The location is very easy to find. And it's in Hongdae, you'll never get bored! The beds were okay, I got the most of my money's worth. Overall, I had a very good experience. I hope to come back to Korea again. I will definitely book to this Guesthouse again. :) Thank you very much! Show more Zirus , Philippines Ekonomy Hotel Sokcho 7.7 Very good Based on 48 reviews Hostel Vanilla Dongdaemun 2 9.1 Exceptional Based on 185 reviews Very helpful and pleasant staff! Nicely decorated, the place is just like the photos, clean, tidy, comfortable and cozy. The location is very close to exit 10 of Dongmyo station, I think it is around 3 mins walk. A convenient store Homeplus express is nearby (on the way of walking to the subway exit),you may also find bars, hair salon, coffee shops and nice restaurants in the quiet neighbourhood. A nice community in general. Moon helped us registering the Rail bike and help us to select and order a perfect combo of fried chicken! We are so impressed. Manager Tae is helpful and nice to get along with. We enjoy the stay a lot, truly feel like home. Stronyly recommended. All kitchenets are there together with basic facilities with manual in dual language. The owner Jay is easy to contact and communicate as he is fluent in English. Jay is also very helpful though we did not meet. Everything through wsap but everything very smooth .Thumbs up !
